messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning]Bread crusts: (was Vegetarian and unschooling)
messages.msgSnippet: ***Sandra wrote: --If the crust is so great, the parents can eat it-- This made me smile. *** Yes, me too!  My dog LOVES it when people don t like various
messages.messageBody:
***Sandra wrote: --If the crust is so great, the parents can eat it--

This made me smile. ***


Yes, me too!  My dog LOVES it when people don't like various food items!  Once the crust is cut off, we keep it on the plate, and sometimes it gets eaten separate and sometimes it is used to keep the dog from being too near someone's plate, to toss and have the dog go to whatever it is that got tossed in the direction away from a plate.

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning]Bread crusts: (was Vegetarian and unschooling)
messages.msgSnippet: Sandra wrote: --If the crust is so great, the parents can eat it-- This made me smile.  My kids will eat sandwich crusts but not pizza crusts so they always
messages.messageBody:
Sandra wrote: --If the crust is so great, the parents can eat it--

This made me smile. My kids will eat sandwich crusts but not pizza crusts
so they always bring them to me. My 7 yr old daughter always says "Here's
some yummy crust for you!" and my husband and I always pretend to fight
over who gets the yummy crust. We laugh and laugh and enjoy the pizza.

http://sandradodd.com/eating/peace


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
